title: Fostering Resilience: FGP discusses climate action, economic growth
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 24 (APP):Freedom Gate Prosperity (FGP) recently convened a strategic consultative session to deliberate on practical solutions for Pakistan’s most pressing development challenges, including climate resilience, economic empowerment of youth and women and fostering inclusive growth.
The session brought together Ammara Durrani, a renowned opinion leader in the development sector, alongside FGP’s CEO, Muhammad Anwar and senior experts Farhan Javaid and Shafqat Aziz.
This collaborative effort aimed to explore innovative approaches to addressing these critical issues.
The candid discussion focused on evolving risks and opportunities within the development landscape, and the need for cross-sector collaborations to drive sustainable impact.
Sharing her perspective, Ammara Durrani remarked, “It is encouraging to see organizations like FGP engaging in deeper reflections on how to connect field realities with broader policy frameworks. A meaningful community level engagement and engaging local media at district level would play crucial role addressing existing disconnect from policy to delverence.”
Muhammad Anwar, CEO of FGP, emphasized the value of such engagements, stating, “Partnerships based on shared understanding and openness are vital to address complex development challenges such as climate vulnerability and economic marginalization. Dialogues like this help shape our strategic direction for scalable and inclusive solutions.”
The session concluded with a mutual commitment to continue knowledge sharing, explore collaborative initiatives, and connect grassroots innovation with national development priorities to address climate adaptation, skills development, and economic opportunity for underserved populations.
